page.title: 07Stoke-by-Clare V.C.P.School
page.content:
This school is due to close in July 1986.It has only 7 children on roll.The village put up a strong fight in 1977 when closure was first suggested.In 1979 the county council voted down the closure proposal but Stoke agreed to a self help scheme.The Mary Barnes Charity agreed to make an annual contribution to the costs and the county agreed to keep the school open until 1986.
128 years after it was first established it will close;a cause of concern to those in the village who believe this may have a profound effect on the future of Stoke itself. Will new families move to a village with no school or are they more likely to move to larger centres of population?
